title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 8 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 1 Chronicles chapter 8 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 8 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 1 Chronicles Chapter 8.

questions.question: Who was the firstborn son of Benjamin according to 1 Chronicles 8?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 8:1 states that Benjamin begat Bela his firstborn.

questions.question: Which of the following was NOT a son of Bela?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 8:3-5 lists Addar, Gera, and Abihud as sons of Bela, but Saul is a descendant of Kish, not Bela.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 Chronicles 8, Ehud was one of the heads of the fathers of the inhabitants of Geba.
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 8:6 states that these are the sons of Ehud, who were heads of the fathers of the inhabitants of Geba.

questions.question: Where did Shaharaim have children according to 1 Chronicles 8?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 8:8 says Shaharaim begat children in the country of Moab after he had sent them away.

questions.question: Who was the wife of the father of Gibeon mentioned in 1 Chronicles 8?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 8:29 states that the father of Gibeon's wife's name was Maachah.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 Chronicles 8, Saul was a son of Ner.
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 8:33 explains that Ner begat Kish, Kish begat Saul.

questions.question: How many sons did Azel have according to 1 Chronicles 8?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 8:38 lists six sons of Azel by name.

questions.question: Which city is mentioned as being built by Shamed, son of Elpaal?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 8:12 states that Shamed, son of Elpaal, built Ono and Lod.

questions.question: Complete this verse from 1 Chronicles 8:40: 'The sons of Ulam were mighty men of valour, archers, and had many sons, and sons' sons, an ______.'
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 8:40 states that the sons of Ulam had sons, and sons' sons, an hundred and fifty.

questions.question: Who was the son of Jonathan mentioned in 1 Chronicles 8?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 8:34 says the son of Jonathan was Meribbaal.

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 Chronicles 8, the inhabitants of Aijalon were driven away by the heads of the fathers Beriah and Shema.
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 8:13 states Beriah and Shema were heads of the fathers of the inhabitants of Aijalon who drove away the inhabitants of Gath.

questions.question: Who did Ner beget according to 1 Chronicles 8?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 8:33 states Ner begat Kish.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT listed as a son of Shashak in 1 Chronicles 8?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 8:25-26 lists Iphedeiah and Penuel as sons of Shashak; Shamsherai and Shehariah are also listed nearby, but Athaliah is listed as a son of Jeroham in verse 26-27.

questions.question: Who was the father of Kish according to 1 Chronicles 8?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 8:33 states Ner begat Kish.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'And Saul begat Jonathan, and _______, and Abinadab, and Eshbaal.'
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 8:33 lists Saul's sons as Jonathan, Malchishua, Abinadab, and Eshbaal.

medium.title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 8 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 1 Chronicles Chapter 8 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is seeking to understand the importance of family legacy in faith. Based on 1 Chronicles 8, what biblical truth about family heritage would you share?
options: God values the preservation of faithful family lines as a foundation for community strength
Family names are unimportant compared to individual achievements
Only the youngest children carry on the spiritual legacy
Family heritage is irrelevant to one's spiritual life
questions.correctAnswer: God values the preservation of faithful family lines as a foundation for community strength
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 8 records detailed genealogies highlighting the importance of family lines and their role in the community, emphasizing God’s valuing of faithful family heritage (verses 1-40).

questions.question: A believer struggles with perseverance through trials and wants to learn from biblical examples. How does the genealogy in 1 Chronicles 8 encourage perseverance?
options: By showing continuous faithfulness of families despite challenges and relocations
By focusing only on the successes of key individuals
By ignoring the struggles of ancestors
By emphasizing wealth and power as proof of God's favor
questions.correctAnswer: By showing continuous faithfulness of families despite challenges and relocations
questions.explanation: The chapter shows families relocating and facing changes (verse 6, 8), yet maintaining their identity and faith, teaching perseverance through changes and trials.

questions.question: How does 1 Chronicles 8 teach about the value of humility and contentment in family life?
options: By listing family heads without boasting, emphasizing each person's role
By highlighting only the most powerful individuals
By encouraging competition among family members
questions.correctAnswer: By listing family heads without boasting, emphasizing each person's role
questions.explanation: The genealogy provides an unembellished record of names and roles (verses 10-28), which models humility and contentment in fulfilling one's God-ordained place.

questions.question: A believer wants to understand how to apply biblical wisdom in parenting. According to 1 Chronicles 8, what principle about spiritual heritage should parents teach their children?
options: To preserve faith and obedience through generations
To focus solely on material success
To avoid talking about family history
To prioritize personal ambition over family values
questions.correctAnswer: To preserve faith and obedience through generations
questions.explanation: The passage shows a detailed lineage emphasizing passing on faith and identity from parents to children (verses 33-40), underscoring the importance of spiritual heritage.

questions.question: How does 1 Chronicles 8 encourage honesty and integrity in daily life through its record of genealogies?
options: By faithfully recording each individual's name and lineage
By omitting those who were less honorable
By exaggerating the achievements of ancestors
By focusing on wealth and status
questions.correctAnswer: By faithfully recording each individual's name and lineage
questions.explanation: The chapter's careful and honest recording of genealogies demonstrates integrity and respect for truth in documenting history (verses 1-40).

questions.question: A believer is struggling with the challenge of serving others in the church. Based on 1 Chronicles 8, what biblical insight can encourage them?
options: Every member has a unique role to contribute faithfully to the community
Service is optional and not important
Service is only for the most gifted
questions.correctAnswer: Every member has a unique role to contribute faithfully to the community
questions.explanation: The passage lists many individuals with different roles and families, indicating that each person contributes to the whole (verses 13-28).

questions.question: How does the passage in 1 Chronicles 8 demonstrate the value of prayer and personal devotion in building a godly family?
options: By showing the continuity of godly families who trusted God throughout generations
questions.correctAnswer: By showing the continuity of godly families who trusted God throughout generations
questions.explanation: The genealogies reflect families that maintained faithfulness and trust in God, implying the importance of spiritual discipline in sustaining family legacy (verses 33-40).

questions.question: True or False: 1 Chronicles 8 shows that Benjamin was the father of several sons, including Bela, Ashbel, and Aharah.
questions.explanation: Verse 1 explicitly states that Benjamin begat Bela, Ashbel, and Aharah as his sons.

questions.question: True or False: 1 Chronicles 8 mentions that Saul was a descendant of Benjamin through his father Kish.
questions.explanation: Verse 33 records that Ner begat Kish, Kish begat Saul, linking Saul to the tribe of Benjamin.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with contentment in their family role. According to 1 Chronicles 8, which principle would you share?
options: Each person’s place in the family and community is important and honored
Only the firstborn children are valuable
Family roles should be competed for aggressively
questions.correctAnswer: Each person’s place in the family and community is important and honored
questions.explanation: The chapter lists many names and roles without elevating some above others, teaching respect and contentment in one’s God-given role (verses 29-32).

questions.question: How does 1 Chronicles 8 teach about the importance of generosity and stewardship in family life?
options: By showing families settled in cities and towns managing their inheritance responsibly
By focusing on wealth accumulation only
questions.correctAnswer: By showing families settled in cities and towns managing their inheritance responsibly
questions.explanation: Verses 12-13 mention building and inhabiting towns, suggesting responsible stewardship of family resources.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: According to 1 Chronicles 8, ___ begat Saul, who became the first king of Israel.
questions.explanation: Verse 33 states, 'Ner begat Kish, and Kish begat Saul.'

questions.question: A believer wants to learn about humility from the passage in 1 Chronicles 8. What would you tell them?
options: Humility is shown by faithfully recording every family member’s name without pride
Humility means hiding one’s family history
questions.correctAnswer: Humility is shown by faithfully recording every family member’s name without pride
questions.explanation: The chapter records many names simply and honestly without boasting, modeling humility (verses 14-27).

questions.question: How does 1 Chronicles 8 encourage believers to handle temptation and persevere?
options: By demonstrating families who remained steadfast through generations
By ignoring challenges faced by ancestors
By promoting avoidance of family responsibilities
questions.correctAnswer: By demonstrating families who remained steadfast through generations
questions.explanation: The continued lineage despite relocations and challenges illustrates perseverance and faithfulness (verses 6-8, 33-40).

questions.question: According to 1 Chronicles 8, what does the detailed listing of family heads teach about church life and fellowship?
options: That leadership and fellowship involve many individuals working together
That only a few leaders matter
That church life should be exclusive
questions.correctAnswer: That leadership and fellowship involve many individuals working together
questions.explanation: The listing of many family heads and their descendants shows a broad fellowship of leaders and members working together (verses 13-28).

hard.title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 8 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 1 Chronicles Chapter 8.

questions.question: Who was the firstborn son of Benjamin according to 1 Chronicles 8?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 8:1 states that Benjamin's firstborn was Bela.

questions.question: Which city is mentioned as being built by the sons of Elpaal?
questions.explanation: Verse 12 states that the sons of Elpaal built Ono and Lod with their towns.

questions.question: In 1 Chronicles 8, which wife of Shaharaim bore Jobab, Zibia, Mesha, and Malcham?
questions.explanation: Verse 9 specifies that Hodesh, wife of Shaharaim, bore these sons.

questions.question: What is the significance of the genealogy of Saul in 1 Chronicles 8 in relation to the broader biblical narrative?
options: It connects the royal lineage of Israel to the tribe of Benjamin.
It highlights the Levites as key religious leaders.
It shows the exile of Benjaminites to Babylon.
It details the priestly lineage of Aaron.
questions.correctAnswer: It connects the royal lineage of Israel to the tribe of Benjamin.
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 8:33 traces the lineage from Ner to Kish to Saul, showing Saul's tribal affiliation to Benjamin, which is critical for understanding Israel's monarchy.

questions.question: Which of the following sons of Elpaal is mentioned as a father of mighty men of valour?
questions.explanation: The sons of Elpaal include Eber, Misham, and Shamed, but the text attributes mighty men of valour to the descendants of Ulam, son of Eshek, not Elpaal’s sons directly. Therefore, this tests understanding of family lines.

questions.question: According to 1 Chronicles 8, which city did the inhabitants of Aijalon drive away its former occupants?
questions.explanation: Verse 13 states that the inhabitants of Aijalon drove away the inhabitants of Gath.

questions.question: The genealogy in 1 Chronicles 8 reflects which historical and cultural practice in the ancient Near East?
options: Preserving tribal heritage and claims to land
questions.correctAnswer: Preserving tribal heritage and claims to land
questions.explanation: Genealogies like those in 1 Chronicles 8 served to affirm tribal identities and territorial claims, a common practice in the ancient Near East.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT listed as a son of Shaharaim?
questions.explanation: Mikloth is mentioned later as a descendant in verse 32, but not as a son of Shaharaim. Shaharaim's sons include Jobab, Zibia, and Mesha (verses 9-11).

questions.question: True or False: According to 1 Chronicles 8, the descendants of Ulam were archers and mighty men of valour numbering about one hundred and fifty.
questions.explanation: Verse 40 states that the sons of Ulam were mighty men of valour, archers, and had many descendants, about 150 in number.

questions.question: Who is recorded as the father of Kish, the father of Saul, in this genealogy?
questions.explanation: Verse 33 clearly states that Ner begat Kish, who begat Saul.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The sons of Azel included Azrikam, Bocheru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah, and ___.
questions.explanation: Verse 38 lists the sons of Azel, ending with Hanan as the last son named.

questions.question: What literary purpose does the detailed genealogy in 1 Chronicles 8 serve for the post-exilic community?
options: To reestablish tribal identities and connect them to their ancestral heritage after exile
To provide a prophetic vision of the future kingdom
To document the architectural history of Jerusalem
questions.correctAnswer: To reestablish tribal identities and connect them to their ancestral heritage after exile
questions.explanation: The Chronicler’s genealogies aimed to restore a sense of identity and continuity for the returned exiles by tracing their lineage and tribal affiliations.

questions.question: Which of the following is a parallel found in 1 Chronicles 8 that reflects the tribal division and headship common in ancient Israelite genealogies?
options: Listing heads of fathers and chiefs of clans
questions.correctAnswer: Listing heads of fathers and chiefs of clans
questions.explanation: The chapter repeatedly notes 'heads of the fathers' and chief men, reflecting a structure of tribal leadership and organization.

questions.question: How does the genealogy of Saul in 1 Chronicles 8 foreshadow the transition from tribal leadership to monarchy in Israel?
options: By tracing his lineage from tribal heads to the first king of Israel
By emphasizing priestly ancestry over royal lineage
By focusing on the Levitical tribes
By mentioning the exile of Benjamin
questions.correctAnswer: By tracing his lineage from tribal heads to the first king of Israel
questions.explanation: The genealogy connects Saul to the tribe of Benjamin, showing the tribal basis for his kingship, which marks Israel's shift from tribal confederation to monarchy.

questions.question: Which of the following individuals mentioned in 1 Chronicles 8 was associated with the city of Gibeon?
questions.explanation: Verse 29 mentions 'the father of Gibeon' who dwelt at Gibeon, highlighting tribal or clan affiliation with that city.

theological.title: 1 Chronicles Chapter 8 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 1 Chronicles Chapter 8 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: Who was the firstborn son of Benjamin according to 1 Chronicles 8?
questions.explanation: 1 Chronicles 8:1 states that Benjamin begat Bela as his firstborn. This establishes the genealogical order, emphasizing the importance of lineage in God's providential plan (Genesis 35:18; Romans 11:1; Hebrews 7:14; Revelation 5:5).

questions.question: Which city is associated with the heads of the fathers of the inhabitants as mentioned in this chapter?
questions.explanation: Verse 6 identifies the sons of Ehud as heads of the fathers of the inhabitants of Geba, showing the tribal settlements ordained by God (Joshua 18:24; Nehemiah 11:31; 2 Samuel 5:25; Psalm 48:1).

questions.question: In 1 Chronicles 8, which wife of Shaharaim bore Jobab, Zibia, Mesha, and Malcham?
questions.explanation: Verse 9 specifies Hodesh as the wife of Shaharaim who bore those sons, illustrating the significance of family lines within God's covenant community (Genesis 29:31; Ruth 4:13; Matthew 1:3; Luke 3:26).

questions.question: Which two cities were built by the sons of Elpaal as mentioned in this chapter?
questions.explanation: Verse 12 states that the sons of Elpaal built Ono and Lod, demonstrating God's providence in the establishment of Israelite settlements (Joshua 15:41; Ezra 2:33; Nehemiah 11:35; Acts 9:32).

questions.question: Who were the inhabitants driven away by the heads of the fathers of Aijalon?
questions.explanation: Verse 13 mentions that the inhabitants of Aijalon drove away the inhabitants of Gath, reflecting God's promise to give the land to Israel and the fulfillment of conquest (Joshua 10:3; Judges 1:18; 1 Samuel 17:4; Psalm 44:2).

questions.question: Which city did the chiefs and families mentioned in 1 Chronicles 8 primarily dwell in?
questions.explanation: Verse 28 notes that these chiefs dwelt in Jerusalem, which is significant as the center of worship and God's presence, foreshadowing Christ's messianic rule (2 Samuel 5:6-7; Psalm 132:13-14; John 4:21; Revelation 21:2).

questions.question: Who was the father of Kish and ancestor of Saul, according to this chapter?
questions.explanation: Verse 33 records that Ner begat Kish, and Kish was the father of Saul, establishing the Davidic line's royal beginnings and God's sovereign election (1 Samuel 9:1-2; Romans 9:15-16; Acts 13:22; Hebrews 11:32).

questions.question: Who was the son of Jonathan and father of Micah?
questions.explanation: Verse 34 states that Jonathan's son was Meribbaal, who begat Micah, illustrating the preservation of lineage despite political turmoil (2 Samuel 21:7; 1 Chronicles 9:39; Matthew 1:5; Luke 3:30).

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT listed as a son of Micah?
questions.explanation: Verse 35 lists Pithon, Melech, Tarea, and Ahaz as sons of Micah, while Zichri appears elsewhere (verses 19 and 27), indicating distinct family lines (Numbers 1:44; Joshua 7:1; 1 Chronicles 8:19; 1 Chronicles 8:27).

questions.question: Which son of Azel had six sons, including Azrikam and Bocheru?
questions.explanation: Verse 38 explains that Azel had six sons named Azrikam, Bocheru, and others, emphasizing the continuity of the tribe and God's faithfulness to His promise of numerous descendants (Genesis 15:5; Exodus 1:7; Psalm 127:3; Matthew 1:1).

questions.question: What characteristic is attributed to the sons of Ulam in this chapter?
options: Mighty men of valour and archers
questions.correctAnswer: Mighty men of valour and archers
questions.explanation: Verse 40 describes Ulam's sons as mighty men of valour and archers, reflecting God's provision of strength and protection for His people (Judges 6:12; 2 Samuel 23:8; Isaiah 41:10; Ephesians 6:10-11).

questions.question: Which of the following names is NOT mentioned as a son of Beriah?
questions.explanation: Verses 16 and 36 mention Michael, Ispah, and Joha as sons of Beriah, while Zimri is noted as a descendant of Jehoadah (verse 36), showing distinct genealogical branches (Numbers 25:14; 1 Chronicles 8:16; 1 Chronicles 8:36; Romans 4:11).

questions.question: Who was the wife of the father of Gibeon as mentioned in this chapter?
questions.explanation: Verse 29 states the wife of the father of Gibeon was Maachah, highlighting the importance of family and covenantal relationships in Israel's history (2 Samuel 3:3; 1 Kings 15:2; Matthew 1:3; Luke 3:26).

questions.question: Which son of Jehoadah begat Alemeth, Azmaveth, and Zimri?
questions.explanation: Verse 36 reveals that Ahaz begat Jehoadah, who begat Alemeth, Azmaveth, and Zimri, illustrating the detailed genealogical record that affirms God's faithfulness in preserving His people (Genesis 5:3; Luke 3:30; Hebrews 11:12; Romans 9:6).

questions.question: Which name is listed as a son of Shaharaim born in the country of Moab?
questions.explanation: Verse 9 identifies Jobab as a son of Shaharaim born in Moab, underscoring God's providential preservation of the lineage even in foreign lands (Ruth 1:4; Genesis 19:37; Numbers 22:1; Acts 7:45).
